body.p: Academic research, outreach performed and feedback received throughout the project highlighted that the main concern associated with lessor disclosure in IAS 17 was the lack of information about a lessor’s exposure to credit risk (associated with the lease payments receivable from the lessee) and asset risk (associated with the lessor’s residual interest in the underlying asset). Particularly for leases classified as operating leases, lessors could retain significant residual asset risk and little, if any, information was generally available about that exposure to risk in the financial statements.
